module.name: class_of_product_library
module.keywords: module, class, library, set theory, product, relationship, structure, process plant

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record:

ul.li: classes of product, and composition, connection and containment relationships between them;
classes of composition, connection and containment relationship betweeen products;
a hierarchy of specialisation relationships between classes of product and classes of relationship between products.

li.p: the existence of a class of product;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_structure application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of product and another that indicates the nature of a whole-part relationship between two individual products;
li.note: A mapping between classes of product is a class that has relationships between individual activities as members;
This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_structure application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of product and another that indicates the nature of a connection relationship between two individual products;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_structure application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of product and another that indicates the nature of a containment relationship between two individual products;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_structure application module.

li.p: set theory relationships, such as subset, union and intersection, between classes of product and between mappings.
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Set_theory application module. The application of the capability to classes of product or relationships between classes of product is specified by this part of ISO 10303.
Individual product is within the scope of the Product_as_individual application module.

li.p: membership of a class of product;
li.note: Membership of a class of product is within the scope of the Product_structure_and_classification application module.

li.p: the involvement of classes of product, classes of documents, classes of people and classes of organisation in a class of activity.
li.note: The involvement of a class of product in a class of activity is within the scope of the Class_of_involvement_in_activity application module.

uof.name: class_of_product_library
uof.description: The class_of_product_library UOF provides the ability to record information about classes of product, their structure, and set theory relationships between them.
